title: Error sending email after moving domain to new host
content:
Hi,

I have moved my domain from one.com to dreamhost.com. I use the same email as I always have: me@mydomain.com. When I send mail using the thunderbird client on my windows desktop, I get this message: >>> from Postmaster <support@one.com> This is the mail system at host send.one.com. I'm sorry to have to inform you that your message could not be delivered to one or more recipients. It's attached below. <<<

I assume there is still a setting that uses 'send.one.com', but I cannot find it. Who can help me out?

Mark

title: Having only Thunderbird receive emails
content: I bought a new computer and had to download Thunderbird again. I tried the most recent one, didn't like it, so randomly picked a previous release from 2023 (don't remember when I installed the previous one) and hoped for the best. In the past, I would keep some emails in my inbox and tend to them as needed and then keep or delete when I had done what was required. I would also need to go to my ISP email's page, to get spam email, because Thunderbird didn't provide me with those. When there, I would delete what was in the inbox, so I could easily keep letters there to a minimum. Now, however, when I delete something in my ISP's inbox, it deletes in my Thunderbird portal too. I can't find settings in my ISP's page to stop it from downloading automatically (so it won't duplicate what I've already received via Thunderbird), and I can't find any settings in Thunderbird, to ask it to keep what I have in my inbox, instead of deleting everything I delete with my ISP. Do I need to go further back and find an earlier release in order to be able to use Thunderbird as I used to do? Or can I tweak the one I have?
creator: alan410

title: Update from 115 to 128
content: When Thunderbird updated from version 115 to 128 I lost access to my emails and calendar. I have tried to link the current installation to this Onedrive folder with no luck and any attempt to run the program creates an installation directory under Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\ with a bunch of files and I have no access to my prior installation. How do I recover my data and keep the Thunderbird files in Onedrive?

title: 14 Feb 2025: Firefox and Thunderbird have lost all account settings and pages
content:
Desktop PC running latest Thunderbird and Firefox. Started Thunderbird, instead of the usual tabs opening, it appears to have forgotten my accounts, asks for my email address, i.e. starting from scratch again. Starting Firefox, all previously-open tabs have gone, though bookmarks are all there.

Has there been some update which has wiped or reset Mozilla data? Yes, obviously I can go through setting up Thunderbird again but that will take quite some time and yes, I can use Firefox but many of the tabs I had open were there for a reason and it will take a while to find them all again.

Is there any way that the previous state can be recovered? My laptop has both applications running fine and I have paused Windows updates for a week, just in case the latest update caused this. Thank you.

title: Unable to login to exchange account with MFA on thunderbird v128 and above
content:
Hi,

I have two email accounts I use on thunderbird (one for work and other for personal use). My organization uses MFA with MS exchange as the email service and it has been tricky to use my work email after the update to v128. This is on my personal laptop.

On my office PC, having the exact same thunderbird configuration (but running v115) works perfectly with this account (which is problematic with my personal laptop).

Here's the issue: when opening thunderbird with my work email account, the window pops-up asking me for my account credentials (username and password). After typing the password and pressing enter, the password field simply erases my password and prompts me to type again. This is an iterative process with no work-around that I could figure out.

Attached is an screenshot of the pop-up.

I'd really appreciate any help on this. Thanks!

title: Moment in Time email...
content:
I am De-Googling. My Gmail is still active but I turned off Thunderbird access via Google settings. I then proceeded to make vast changes to Gmail folder structure, labels, etc. because I mistakenly thought it was a good idea to start cleaning before I thought it all through. I went to Thunderbird to check for an email I deleted and realized it's going to prompt me to log in every time I open the app. I went looking for a solution and found out Thunderbird isn't set up for me to archive in this way. But can I?

I still have the Gmail account and will for some time as it was my main account for decades. I can connect it back to Thunderbird but I do not want any changes to folders or labels email location when I link it back up?

Is this possible?

If not, how do I move the account as it exists on Thunderbird so I have a usable offline account that will represent what I had before my mistakes? Thanks for your help

title: Emails with just frames instead of some pasted images
content:
This bug shows up in Thunderbird 115.18.0 (64-Bit) on Xubuntu 22.04.5 LTS, but it might be present also in other versions.

When I am discussing software topics, I often write emails about what I did and what happened then. I document my findings with pasted screenshots. The emails are HTML-Type emails.

While I am composing these emails, everything looks perfectly ok.

But once the email is sent, it arrives at its destination without some of the pasted pictures and only with frames showing the sizes of those pictures! When I look op those emails under "sent", some of the later suppressed pictures miss from there. It looks like TB switches to a "loose pictures" mode once and sticks to it for that particular email. It looks like the probability of being hit by this bug increases with the number of pasted pictures.

Note: This complaint is different from this one https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1183434, where it is about pictures copied and pasted from the web (where it might be the case that instead of the picture an Internet link gets posted: My complaint is about pictures not related to any internet source but rather to pictures from my screenshooter utility, which is xfce4-screenshooter (I am on Linux, in particular on Xubuntu 20.04).

The first (usually 1 or 2) pictures arrive well at the destination of the email but if the number of pasted screenshots exceeds 4 or 5, the bug shows up. The really bad thing is that when I am composing the mail, everything looks perfectly ok. I can only tell if a mail is affected from this bug, when the email is sent - and then it is too late!
creator: perpetuum-mobile
